project.name: adapterjs
project.description: Creating a common API for WebRTC in the browser

classitems.description: Contains the options of the Temasys Plugin.
classitems.name: options

subprops.name: getAllCams
subprops.description:
Option to get virtual cameras.
  Override this value here.

subprops.name: hidePluginInstallPrompt
subprops.description:
Option to prevent
  the install prompt when the plugin in not yet installed.
  Override this value here.

classitems.description: The current version of the Temasys AdapterJS.
classitems.name: VERSION.

classitems.description:
The event function that will be called when the WebRTC API is
  ready to be used in cross-browsers.
If you decide not to override use this synchronisation, it may result in
  an extensive CPU usage on the plugin start (once per tab loaded).
Override this function to synchronise the start of your application
  with the WebRTC API being ready.
classitems.name: onwebrtcready

return.description:
Returns a boolean in the event function that
  indicates if the WebRTC plugin is being used, false otherwise.

classitems.description: Checks if maybe WebRTC is already ready.
classitems.name: maybeThroughWebRTCReady

classitems.description: The result of ICE connection states.
classitems.name: _iceConnectionStates

classitems.description: The IceConnection states that has been fired for each peer.
classitems.name: _iceConnectionFiredStates

subprops.name: (#peerId)
subprops.description: The ICE connection fired states for this peerId.

classitems.description: Check if WebRTC Interface is defined.
classitems.name: isDefined

classitems.description:
This function helps to retrieve the webrtc detected browser information.
This sets:
webrtcDetectedBrowser: The browser agent name.
- webrtcDetectedVersion: The browser version.
- webrtcDetectedType: The types of webRTC support.
  - 'moz': Mozilla implementation of webRTC.
  - 'webkit': WebKit implementation of webRTC.
  - 'plugin': Using the plugin implementation.
classitems.name: parseWebrtcDetectedBrowser

classitems.description:
To fix configuration as some browsers does not support
 the 'urls' attribute.
classitems.name: maybeFixConfiguration

classitems.description: Adds an event listener for Temasys plugin objects.
classitems.name: addEvent

classitems.description:
Detected webrtc implementation. Types are:
- 'moz': Mozilla implementation of webRTC.
- 'webkit': WebKit implementation of webRTC.
- 'plugin': Using the plugin implementation.
classitems.name: webrtcDetectedType

classitems.description:
Detected webrtc datachannel support. Types are:
- 'SCTP': SCTP datachannel support.
- 'RTP': RTP datachannel support.
classitems.name: webrtcDetectedType

classitems.description:
Set the settings for creating DataChannels, MediaStream for
  Cross-browser compability. This is only for SCTP based support browsers.
classitems.name: checkMediaDataChannelSettings

params.name: callback
params.description:
The callback that gets fired once the function is
  completed.

return.description:
(beOfferer, updatedConstraints)
  Returns a flag beOfferer if the peer should be the offer and also the updated unified
  RTCOfferOptions constraints.

classitems.description:
Handles the differences for all browsers ice connection state output.
Tested outcomes are:
- Chrome (offerer)  : 'checking' > 'completed' > 'completed'
- Chrome (answerer) : 'checking' > 'connected'
- Firefox (offerer) : 'checking' > 'connected'
- Firefox (answerer): 'checking' > 'connected'
classitems.name: checkIceConnectionState

params.name: peerId
params.description: The peerId of the peer to check.

params.name: iceConnectionState
params.description: The peer's current ICE connection state.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback that returns the updated connected state.

return.description:
(state)
Returns the updated ICE connection state.

classitems.description: Contains the plugin information.
classitems.name: pluginInfo

subprops.name: onload
subprops.description:
The Javascript function to trigger when
  the plugin object has loaded.

subprops.name: downloadLink
subprops.description:
The link to download new versions
  of the plugin.

classitems.description: Contains the unique identifier of each opened page
classitems.name: pageId

classitems.description: Use this whenever you want to call the plugin.
classitems.name: plugin

classitems.description:
Sets log level for the plugin once it is ready.
This is an asynchronous function that will run when the plugin is ready
classitems.name: setLogLevel

classitems.description:
Defines webrtc's JS interface according to the plugin's implementation.
Define plugin Browsers as WebRTC Interface.
classitems.name: defineWebRTCInterface

classitems.description:
This function detects whether or not a plugin is installed.
  we're running IE and do something. If not it is not supported.
classitems.name: isPluginInstalled

classitems.description: Lets adapter.js wait until the the document is ready before injecting the plugin.
classitems.name: pluginInjectionInterval

classitems.description: Injects the HTML DOM object element into the page.
classitems.name: injectPlugin

classitems.description: States of readiness that the plugin goes through when being injected and stated.
classitems.name: PLUGIN_STATES

subprops.name: INJECTED
subprops.description: Plugin element injected but not usable yet

classitems.description:
Current state of the plugin. You cannot use the plugin before this is
 equal to AdapterJS.WebRTCPlugin.PLUGIN_STATES.READY.
classitems.name: pluginState

classitems.description:
True is AdapterJS.onwebrtcready was already called, false otherwise.
Used to make sure AdapterJS.onwebrtcready is only called once.
classitems.name: onwebrtcreadyDone

classitems.description:
Log levels for the plugin.
Log outputs are prefixed in some cases.
From the least verbose to the most verbose
classitems.name: PLUGIN_LOG_LEVELS

subprops.name: ERROR
subprops.description: Errors originating from within the plugin.

classitems.description: Does a waiting check before proceeding to load the plugin.
classitems.name: WaitForPluginReady

classitems.description: This method will use an interval to wait for the plugin to be ready.
classitems.name: callWhenPluginReady

classitems.description:
This function will be called if the plugin is needed (browser different
  from Chrome or Firefox), but the plugin is not installed.
Override it according to your application logic.
classitems.name: pluginNeededButNotInstalledCb

classitems.description:
!!!! WARNING: DO NOT OVERRIDE THIS FUNCTION. !!!
This function will be called when plugin is ready. It sends necessary
  details to the plugin.
The function will wait for the document to be ready and the set the
  plugin state to AdapterJS.WebRTCPlugin.PLUGIN_STATES.READY,
  indicating that it can start being requested.
This function is not in the IE/Safari condition brackets so that
  TemPluginLoaded function might be called on Chrome/Firefox.
This function is the only private function that is not encapsulated to
  allow the plugin method to be called.
classitems.name: pluginNeededButNotInstalledCb
